\item[{function which returns negative paraphrase of given sentence , by changing order of conjunctions}] \leavevmode
dependency tuple format: (word\_parent\textless{}index,text\textgreater{} , dep\_relation , word\_child\textless{}index,text\textgreater{} )
conj\_indx will store indexes of all words modifed as conj (i.e. I like a , b and c) ,so contain index of a , b ,c

\end{description}

\paragraph{Module contents}
\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Hindi:module-ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Hindi}}\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Hindi:module-contents}}\index{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Hindi (module)@\spxentry{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Hindi}\spxextra{module}}

\subsubsection{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam package}
\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:paraphrasedatasetcreation-malayalam-package}}\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam::doc}}

\paragraph{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:submodules}}

\paragraph{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative module}
\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:module-ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative}}\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:paraphrasedatasetcreation-malayalam-negative-module}}\index{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative (module)@\spxentry{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative}\spxextra{module}}
This file houses methods for creating negative paraphrase samples for 
Malayalam. Unlike Hindi, good parsers, Pos-taggers etc are not available
for Malayalam yet. So, some methods used for Hindi cannot be used here. 
Even though IndoWordnet provides synonym functionality, we cannot use 
tags to select the correct ones and so, that is also avoided since it 
created a lot of errors.
\index{NegativeParaphrases (class in ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative)@\spxentry{NegativeParaphrases}\spxextra{class in ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{NegativeParaphrases}}}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

This class houses the methods for creating sentence pairs that are not 
paraphrases. Since we could not find usable open-source packages to find 
synonyms or get parses for Malayalam, we decided to implement various
rule-based approaches. Negative pairs can trivially be created by returning
some unrelated sentence or a non-grammatical sentence. But we intend to 
create grammatical sentences that share same context as the query sentence.
\index{generate() (ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases method)@\spxentry{generate()}\spxextra{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases.generate}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{generate}}}{\emph{sent}}{}
Attempt to generate negative samples using all the implemented methods
and return the aggregated list.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sent}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} sentence to get negative paraphrase samples for.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
list of negative paraphrase samples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list of strings

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{negate\_if\_last\_word\_is\_is() (ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases method)@\spxentry{negate\_if\_last\_word\_is\_is()}\spxextra{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases.negate_if_last_word_is_is}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{negate\_if\_last\_word\_is\_is}}}{\emph{sent}}{}
If the last word of the sentence is ‘ആണ്‌’ (is), then the sentence can be
negated by changing the last word to ‘അല്ല’ (isn’t).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sent}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} sentence to get negative paraphrase samples for.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
list of negative paraphrase samples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list of strings

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{subst\_with\_non\_synonyms() (ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases method)@\spxentry{subst\_with\_non\_synonyms()}\spxextra{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Negative.NegativeParaphrases.subst_with_non_synonyms}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{subst\_with\_non\_synonyms}}}{\emph{sent}}{}
Create negative paraphrase samples by replacing a word with another word 
from the set of non-synonyms.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sent}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} sentence to get negative paraphrase samples for.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
list of negative paraphrase samples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list of strings

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}



\paragraph{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive module}
\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:module-ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive}}\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:paraphrasedatasetcreation-malayalam-positive-module}}\index{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive (module)@\spxentry{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive}\spxextra{module}}
This file houses methods for creating positive paraphrase samples for 
Malayalam. Unlike Hindi, good parsers, Pos-taggers etc are not available
for Malayalam yet. So, some methods used for Hindi cannot be used here. 
Even though IndoWordnet provides synonym functionality, we cannot use 
tags to select the correct ones and so, that is also avoided since it 
created a lot of errors.
\index{PositiveParaphrases (class in ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive)@\spxentry{PositiveParaphrases}\spxextra{class in ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PositiveParaphrases}}}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

This class houses the methods for creating paraphrases for a given
sentence. Since we could not find usable open-source packages to find 
synonyms or get parses for Malayalam, we decided to implement various
rule-based approaches.
\index{back\_translation() (ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method)@\spxentry{back\_translation()}\spxextra{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases.back_translation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{back\_translation}}}{\emph{sent}}{}
Automatic Back Translation can be used to create paraphrases. The 
paraphrases may not always be correct because translators can make errors. 
But like the other methods outlined, this can be used to create an auxiliary
paraphrase dataset.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sent}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list of strings}}) \textendash{} sentence to be paraphrased

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
list of paraphrases

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list of strings

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{generate() (ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method)@\spxentry{generate()}\spxextra{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

for single sentenceand return the aggregated list.

\index{generate\_for\_pair() (ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method)@\spxentry{generate\_for\_pair()}\spxextra{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Attempt to generate positive samples using all the implemented methods 
for pairs of sentences and return aggregated list.

\item {}

\item {}

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{l2}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} language of second sentence in pair

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
list of paraphrases

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list of strings

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{morphology\_and\_agglutination\_based\_paraphrasing() (ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method)@\spxentry{morphology\_and\_agglutination\_based\_paraphrasing()}\spxextra{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases.morphology_and_agglutination_based_paraphrasing}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{morphology\_and\_agglutination\_based\_paraphrasing}}}{\emph{sent}}{}
Malayalam is an agglutinative language. This means that words can get 
clubbed together. But in Malayalam, it is also perfectly valid to write 
these as separate words. For example: “that {[}I{]} saw” can be written as:
” കണ്ടു എന്ന് “, ” കണ്ടെന്നു ” / ” കണ്ടെന്ന് ” or  ” കണ്ടുവെന്ന് ”
Hence, such cases can be used as a rule-based approach to paraphrasing. 
These rules (സന്ധി നിയമങ്ങൾ / Sandhi rules) exist in the language and can 
be coded up. Here we use just one of these rules. Others can also be 
included similarly.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sent}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list of strings}}) \textendash{} sentence to be paraphrased

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
list of paraphrases

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list of strings

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{translate\_pairs\_to\_paraphrases() (ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method)@\spxentry{translate\_pairs\_to\_paraphrases()}\spxextra{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam:ParaphraseDatasetCreation.Malayalam.Positive.PositiveParaphrases.translate_pairs_to_paraphrases}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{translate\_pairs\_to\_paraphrases}}}{\emph{sent1}, \emph{sent2}, \emph{l1}, \emph{l2}}{}
Take a pair of sentences in 2 languages l1 and l2. Then convert both 
sentences into the target language using some pre-existing API. If they are 
not identical, then they could be paraphrases.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sent1}} \textendash{} first sentence in pair

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sent2}} \textendash{} second sentence in pair

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{l1}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} language of first sentence in pair

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{l2}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} language of second sentence in pair

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
list of paraphrases

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list of strings

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}
